content.description: This is a good route that begins in a little stem box at the base. Make your way up the route, and it will begin to start looking clean about halfway up it. It is easier if you trend left and more challenging if you start trending center/right. It is nice and crimpy if you stay right, and it is in the 10b range.
content.protection: Gear is very sparse on the second half of this route. I would not recommend leading. If you do, make sure to bring RPs. There are bolted anchors up top for toprope.
content.location: Left of "Afterwork Warmup" and right of the overhand start route, look for a little stem box at the start.

content.description: The crux is at the start. Climb an overhang with little protection. After pulling the overhang, climb to the right of the arete for an easy finish to the top.
content.protection: Very little protection, especially at the overhang crux start. There are toprope bolted anchors at the top. It is easily accessible by the gully to the right of the wall.
content.location: This is the leftmost route with anchors. It is about as left as you can climb on clean rock.

content.description: This is a line that goes up the right side of the wall. In the middle of the route, you will pull a small roof or you can go just left of it for an easier time.
content.protection: You can lead this on gear, but the top anchors are easy to reach by walking up the gully to the right. The gear is sparse, bring small nuts.
content.location: Start on the right side of the wall, about as far right and still climbing on clean rock.
